html:
PC Number Date Chapter Chapter Year Bill Dept
 2025-03992025-03-12FIN
ActBank Act
SubjectRegulations Amending the Financial Consumer Protection Framework Regulations
PrecisRegulations Amending the FINANCIAL CONSUMER PROTECTION FRAMEWORK REGULATIONS in order to (1) cap non-sufficient funds (NSF) fees at $10 for personal deposit accounts; (2) prohibit the imposition of NSF fees on persons who have been charged an NSF fee within two business days, and on overdrawn amounts of under $10; (3) require banks to alert customers when their account balance falls below zero (or beyond their overdraft limit) as a result of a payment and provide them with a grace period of at least three hours in which they may make a deposit or transfer into their account to cover the payment without being charged an NSF fee; and (4) require banks to publicly disclose the number of NSF fees charged, the number of customers impacted, and the total revenue generated from these fees on an annual basis.
RegistrationRegistration: SOR/ 2025-0096 Publication Date: 2025-03-26
AttachmentsAttachment
precis: Regulations Amending the FINANCIAL CONSUMER PROTECTION FRAMEWORK REGULATIONS in order to (1) cap non-sufficient funds (NSF) fees at $10 for personal deposit accounts; (2) prohibit the imposition of NSF fees on persons who have been charged an NSF fee within two business days, and on overdrawn amounts of under $10; (3) require banks to alert customers when their account balance falls below zero (or beyond their overdraft limit) as a result of a payment and provide them with a grace period of at least three hours in which they may make a deposit or transfer into their account to cover the payment without being charged an NSF fee; and (4) require banks to publicly disclose the number of NSF fees charged, the number of customers impacted, and the total revenue generated from these fees on an annual basis.
